Sentencas: Thermally robust and chemically inert Ag@SiO2 nanoprobes are employed to provide the surface enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) effect for an in situ/operando study of the early stage of carbon deposition on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anodes.
Titulo: An operando surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) study of carbon deposition on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: The enhanced sensitivity to carbon enables the detection of different stages of coking, offering insights into intrinsic coking tolerance of material surfaces.
Titulo: An operando surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) study of carbon deposition on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Application of a thin coating of gadolinium doped ceria (GDC) enhances the resistance to coking of nickel surfaces.
Titulo: An operando surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) study of carbon deposition on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: The electrochemically active Ni-YSZ interface appears to be more active for hydrocarbon reforming, resulting in the accumulation of different hydrocarbon molecules, which can be readily removed upon the application of an anodic current.
Titulo: An operando surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) study of carbon deposition on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Operando SERS is a powerful tool for the mechanistic study of coking in SOFC systems.
Titulo: An operando surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) study of carbon deposition on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: It is also applicable to the study of other catalytic and electro-chemical processes in a wide range of conditions.
Titulo: An operando surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) study of carbon deposition on SOFC anodes
